org.openhab.binding.lcn.logic.data

Class LCNInputModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openhab.binding.lcn.logic.data.LCNModule
      • org.openhab.binding.lcn.logic.data.LCNInputModule

  • public class LCNInputModule
extends LCNModule
    Represents a LCN Module that delivers input (e.g. a sensor). This class is not only used to represent the Modules, but also their input. Basically it is a interim representation of LCNShort Command, LCN Commands and LCN Input, this allows us to compare all three types and figure out in how far they are related.
    Since:
    1.7.0
    Author:
    Patrik Pastuschek

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  LCNInputModule.EngineStatus
      Represents the states of a single engine.
      static class  LCNInputModule.LEDInfo
      A simple class to represent the state of different LEDs.
      static class  LCNInputModule.ModuleType
      Represents the type of module and thus also the kind of data that this module will contain.
      static class  LCNInputModule.SceneData
      Special data class for light scenes.
      static class  LCNInputModule.Threshold
      Special data class for thresholds.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o,
             boolean soft,
             int homeSegment)
        Compares two LCNInputModules. This method will compare the content of the objects and not the objects themselves. An additional flag can be set for softer comparison.
        Overrides:
        equals in class LCNModule
        Parameters:
        o - The object to compare to.
        soft - True if the comparison shall be soft, false otherwise.
        homeSegment - the home segment of one of the modules.
        Returns:
        True if the LCNInputModules are reasonably similar, false otherwise.

      • sameValue

        Parameters:
        mod - The first module.
        inputMod - The second module.
        Returns:
        True if the values inside the modules are the same, false otherwise.
